cancel something ↔ out.translation[0].de: if two things cancel each other out, they are equally important and have an opposite effect to each other, so that neither one has any effect
The losses in our overseas division have cancelled out the profits made in the home market.
cancel something ↔ out.translation[1].de: if one thing cancels out another, it has an equal but opposite effect, so that the effects of the first thing are not felt
The losses in our overseas division have cancelled out this year’s profits.
